last_replies.com:
>>52139907
I'm hoping for B. Pokémon doesn't need complex stories, but it lives on its worldbuilding and lore, it's probably the most interesting part of the franchise.

The reason why I think this generation is special is because of all the information they've given about Paldea. It's not as scattered as it was in previous games, behind random NPCs, somewhat hard to find, etc. Instead most of it is in the Academy, one of the first places you go to, and they even reward you with the classes for learning about the lore of the region. If you read about it and are interested in it, the endgame feels incredibly satisfying because you can finally go to this area that the game has been teasing you with all the time, and... it actually pays off? Like, Sada/Turo's story is genuinely kind of interesting and it presents a cool concept.

Not only that, but Area Zero's research notes, the hints about Paradox Pokémon, also felt really well organized.

I'm not going to call this the best story of all time, but it's definitely the Pokémon story that has been presented in the most satisfying way. SM was close imo but the heavy focus on cutscenes make it reaaaally hard to stomach sometimes. And BW in my opinion are really cool in concept, but... Team Plasma is horribly handled except for probably N. B2W2 is quite a bit more nuanced, but it still lacked the punch SV had for me.

PLA's story was very, very barebones, but at the same time it introduced a couple of really cool ideas to the lore of Pokémon.

I'm just really looking forward to seeing if they keep it up, or if it's going to turn out to be just an exception.

>>52139894
Appears it's still going but originally it was an online flash game you'd play through a browser, so it was playable at computer labs in school before everyone had a computer in their pocket.

It's a platformer where the objective is to get the cheese. About 30 people or so would be in a room and it would randomly select one of those players to be a Magic Mouse and the rest of the players to be regular Mice. Regular Mice could only run and jump but the Magic Mouse could make platforms which were required to get the cheese unless it was a custom map that sucked. Technically both sides could work together but that never really happened. In general the regular Mice would try to get the cheese at the first possible moment the Magic Mouse allowed and the Magic Mouse would attempt to kill as many regular Mice as possible through trickery and then also get the cheese.
It was a fun sort of power dynamic that was infinitely replayable and as long as you weren't super investing in winning it was fun.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
Zoomer here, just finished gen 1 for the 1st time (picrel), here are my thoughts for those interested
>Pokémon
Obviously iconic. Even ignoring the official artwork, the OG sprites are great. People overstate how ugly they are, they have personality. They’re balanced horribly, some are god-like, others are mediocre or shit, but that’s not a flaw, there’s no reason a single player RPG should have to make all the mons equal
>Routes
linear and simplistic, theyre moreso designed around naturally funnelling you through a series of battles rather than for exploring. Theyre serviceable
>Dungeons
Peak dungeon design. They all have a unique gimmick or puzzle, and a lot of them have a major reward at the end. They’re also mostly quite long, testing the player on their item/PP management, which some may find tedious but personally I love it
>Towns/Cities
Hot take but they’re nothing special. They mostly use the same tiles so there’s not a lot setting them apart visually. That said, the music helps, especially places with unique themes, and they all have a handful of notable spots (Celadon especially) so they’re far from bad
>Battles
Disappointingly easy. Brock was a challenge as I had to win at a disadvantage but every other battle was trivial. Most battles, even major ones, just have the terrible level up movesets on top of being monotype, while the player has endless options for decking out their team with whatever mons/moves they want, so I steamrolled every battle with 0 opposition. I swept Sabrina with a lv 35 Elecrode by using light screen/thunderwave, then spamming thunder bolt for fucksake
>Misc
Limited level-up movepools good, incentivizes using TMs. Limited bag space good, incentives item management. Glitches/bugs hardly present. Broken mechanics were fun, loved clamp-locking everything. Level curve surprisingly good but Surge and Erika need to be ~5 levels higher. Story parts nicely told albeit minimal

Gonna start Gold now, anything I should know?

It is, as they say, Champion Time.
I teach Plague Taunt over Cross Poison and Chisel Low Sweep over Night Slash, as I won't be needing either. Both of these, and Haze are ways to deal with Lucario having Nasty Plot.
I lead Cancelled against the Spiritomb. setting up triple Amnesia forces it to use Sucker Punch for meaningful damage, and with Rest on my side, I dictate the pace.
After taking a Scald, Cynthia switches to Roserade however. Not an issue, Cancelled is at near full health, so switch to Plague. However, she switches at the same time, to Gastrodon. For some reason.
U-Turn to Maplethorpe and Giga Drain Gastrodon. What a waste of a perfectly usable Pokemon on her side. Spiritomb comes in and promptly gets ruined by the addition of the Fairy-type.
Next is Milotic, and frankly, fuck Milotic. The slow and boring idea would be to Leech Seed here, then switch to Cancelled, Amnesia thrice and stall until healed back to full, but I opt to speed up the process by Giga Draining twice.
The second Giga Drain + Burn misses the KO by the barest of margins, but that's fine... Milotic has Mirror Coat. Maplethorpe takes massive damage and fucking dies.
I no longer have anything to beat this stupid thing. I really, REALLY should've Leech Seeded.
I go for Cancelled and, without Leech Seed stall for 6 minutes until Cynthia switches to Roserade. Like before, switch to Plague and this time, actually one-shot with Fly.
Milotic is back, and I try to take it down with Taunt + Fly. Despite Plague surviving an extra Ice Beam through Affection bullshit, Cynthia just Full Restores Milotic herself. Hindsight says that Cross Poison might've helped here. Eventually, Plague falls after setting one last Taunt.
I try to make the most of it with Princen't, but due to a Scald Burn my attempts to KO in time are made useless.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>52139923
There's only one way out of this mess, so I wait for a turn where Milotic will recover and switch to Cancelled. I once again set up triple Amnesia, and spent another 6 minutes stalling both Scald and Ice Beam out of PP, before switching to Firedash.
Firedash now safely uses every last Flame Charge over the next 8 minutes, maxing out on speed, and eventually Milotic dies through sheer spite.
Lucario comes in, and Firedash now outspeeds and one-shots the shillmon with Flare Blitz. (He would normally take a hit from non-boosted Lucario even switching in to Flash Cannon)
Finally, Garchomp comes in, and takes middling damage from Flare Blitz before Earthquake. Cancelled can take a hit from Earthquake and attempts a Burn via Scald.
Finally, Chisel comes in, and he can surprisingly take an Earthquake. Regardless, I go for Ice Shard in hopes of a Crit, fail to get it, don't get Crit in return, and from here, Ice Shard trumps Full Restores for the win.
One misplay very nearly lost me the entire fight. Princen't can't take a hit, so if I got Crit at the end, I would've lost

Let's review.
>Princen't really couldn't find anything too notable to do in the E4, the coverage is just too strong.
>Plague has been the carrying force the entire playthrough, and even at the end found new ways to pull his weight.
>Firedash has the most anemic movepool, but he did bully Aaron and his puny insects, and had a small but pivotal role in obliterating Lucario.
>Maplethorpe was the other glue keeping the team together. Did absolutely everything from supporting stallmons to pricking holes against both Bertha and Cynthia.
>Cancelled took the mantle from Cereal, and by god did she manage it in the end. Being able to stop any special attacker in their tracks was invaluable multiple times.
>Chisel was a late addition to the team, mostly to deal with Lucian and Garchomp. While she may not have had much to do outside of that, she performed every task perfectly.

> Meowscarada is based on Mardi Gras
> Skeledirge is based on Día de los Muertos
> Quaquaval is based on Carnival

All festival themed starters.

- Meowscarada sounds like masquerade, referring to masks. Shiny Meowscarada exchanges its pink collar/eyes for purple, another one of the three Mardi Gras colours.

- Coco means 'skull' or 'coconut', and additionally sounds like crocodile. Additionally, a dirge refers to the lamenting/funeral rites of the dead. Skeledirge’s puffy fire is a reference to the marigold flower, the national symbol for the Day of the Dead.

- Quaquaval sounds like carnival, and the peacock motif is a reference to the popular Brazilian Samba dance outfit. Quaquaval is seen dancing during its idle battle animation.
